channel.title: Comments on: GPlusFS: Google+ Data as a Filesystem

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/09/20/gplusfs-google-data-as-a-filesystem/#comment-3848">HarleyPig</a>.
Basic backups would certainly be one use for this. More so if Google exposes more of the data via this API.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to HarleyPig.

Basic backups would certainly be one use for this. More so if Google exposes more of the data via this API.

item.title: By: HarleyPig
item.dc:creator: HarleyPig
item.description:
I forked your project and made it private. Then I cloned my new repo and mounted a directory under my repo. Then I just added the files to my repo and committed them.
A very simple way to back up my google data. Admittedly, it's not a lot, but it's a beginning. Thank you for the gplusfs idea.
item.content:encoded:
I forked your project and made it private. Then I cloned my new repo and mounted a directory under my repo. Then I just added the files to my repo and committed them.

A very simple way to back up my google data. Admittedly, it’s not a lot, but it’s a beginning. Thank you for the gplusfs idea.
